author: g11tech
content: my counter argument is : whether the access list is  valid or complete can only be known by fully executing the block (and its match with the root/hash in block header will become another constraint on the validity of the block, so clients can assume its valid, start block computation using any optimization based on access list, throw invalid as soon as block computation goes out of sync w.r.t. access list), with regard to the "integrity" of access list (irrespective of the order methodology) to prevent grieving, is a easy root check (with the one in block header) similar to how distributed file downloading works.
